diff_hunk:
@@ -716,6 +716,9 @@
 - name: soft_margin_loss_forward(Tensor self, Tensor target, bool size_average, bool reduce)
   self: soft_margin_loss_backward(grad, self, target, size_average, reduce)
 
+- name: relu(Tensor self)
body_html:
nit: You don't need to specify a derivative for relu if you define relu with threshold:

Tensor relu(const Tensor & self) {
  return self.threshold(0, 0);
}

but then it'll look different from the definition of relu_ (there isn't a threshold_ function I think)
